comments:
I tried to add a builder that copies a single, specific file.
So I created an ant builder that does the copy.
I the "Build Options" I choose 
"Specify working set of relevant resources ..."
and marked the single file I wanted to monitor.
This works fine.
When I try to "override and update" this specific file in a CVS synchronize view
I get an error that the file can't be deleted

Choosing the directory that holds the file as relevant resource solves the
problem, but now the builder is executed more often then needed, of course.

Can you attach the log file session for when you get the deletion failure? This
is found under workspace/.metadata/.log.

The log shows a lot of errors.
Most of them seem to be a problem with my XMLBuddy (XML-Editor-Plugin).
Funny enough, the problems don't show up anymore now, so I can't reproduce the bug.
I will attach some of the messages here anyways.

Malte, do you still see the problem if you don't have the XMLBuddy plugin
installed?  I just want to narrow down the possibility that that plugin is
somehow responsible for the deletion failure (this could be related to bug 61790).

As I said before: I couldn't reproduce the bug any more. Not with the XML-Buddy
Plugin and not without.

(By now I installed a new version of eclipse anyways)

Sorry, I missed that comment.  Closing as this is not reproducible.  Please feel
free to reopen if you are able to reproduce with a recent Eclipse build.
